item.title: PARTICIPATION PROJECT
item.description: • Research on flexible wearable system based on triboelectric nanogenerator (Facilitation, Anhui province)
item.content:
• Research on flexible wearable system based on triboelectric nanogenerator (Facilitation, Anhui province)
  • Preparation and performance modulation of polylactic acid-based self-charging textiles (Participated)
  • Construction of self-supplying textiles and optimization of flexible circuits (Participated)

item.title: RESEARCH EXPERENCES
item.description:
Flexible Energy Storage Related Materials Preparation    09/2020-Present

  • Preparation of cathode electrodes for flexible batteries on silver-plated nylon fabrics by magnetron sputtering method (Undergraduate dissertation).
  • Preparation of separator of zinc ion battery on waste ZrO2 fibers by wet forming method. This work provides a novel perspective for replacing commercial glass fiber separators.
  • Focusing on the low-rate performance issues confronted by vanadium-based materials as cathodes for flexible batteries. We realize rapid electron transfer by constructing heterojunction structures between highly conductive (PPy, MXene, et al.) materials and active substances. This strategy effectively reduces the charge-transfer cell and thus extends the battery duration.
item.content:
Flexible Energy Storage Related Materials Preparation    09/2020-Present

  • Preparation of cathode electrodes for flexible batteries on silver-plated nylon fabrics by magnetron sputtering method (Undergraduate dissertation).
  • Preparation of separator of zinc ion battery on waste ZrO2 fibers by wet forming method. This work provides a novel perspective for replacing commercial glass fiber separators.
  • Focusing on the low-rate performance issues confronted by vanadium-based materials as cathodes for flexible batteries. We realize rapid electron transfer by constructing heterojunction structures between highly conductive (PPy, MXene, et al.) materials and active substances. This strategy effectively reduces the charge-transfer cell and thus extends the battery duration.
  • Incorporating alkali metals or organic molecules to expand the interlayer spacing of cathode is a common strategy to increase battery capacity. However larger lattices are prone to structural collapse, which has received little attention in previous studies. Now, I am looking forward a strategy not only increase the lattice interlayer, but also keep its stability.

Fiber Sharped Triboelectric Nanogenerators for Energy Harvest and Sensor   09/2021-08/2023

  • Inspired by blood vessels, a fiber-sharped TENG was designed with a hollow tubular structure, which can realize two TENG working mode. It is the first study that explores the output electrical performance with different modes in deep. -By using the braiding technique, fibrous TENG with smaller fineness is prepared and integrated into the fabric. In addition, with the help of machine learning, we realize the function of motion recognition by prepared smart fabric.

item.title: PREPRINTS and MANUSCRIPTS
item.description: • [1] Wenqi Nie#, Shuai Xu#, Jiangdong Sun, et al. Scale-production, stretchable, fiber triboelectric nanogenerator construct of customizable textile as human motion recognition (Advanced Fiber Materials, under review)
item.content:

  • [2] Wenqi Nie#, Jiangdong Sun #, Shuai Xu#, et al. Boosted charge-transfer behavior for ultrafast Zn storage by constructing intrinsic heterojunction of ammonium vanadate nanoribbons coupling with interlaminar MXenes nanosheets (Chemical Engineering Journal, Revision)

item.title: SELECTED PUBLICATIONS
item.description: • [1] Shuai Xu#, Wenqi Nie#, Jiangdong Sun, et al. Multi-mode and durable fiber triboelectric nanogenerator for power and sensor enabled by Hookean vascular stent structure.Chemical Engineering Journal, 2023,472,145088. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cej.2023.145088.
item.content:
• [1] Shuai Xu#, Wenqi Nie#, Jiangdong Sun, et al. Multi-mode and durable fiber triboelectric nanogenerator for power and sensor enabled by Hookean vascular stent structure.Chemical Engineering Journal, 2023,472,145088. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cej.2023.145088.

  • [2] Shuai Xu, Wenqi Nie, Pengfei Sun, et al. Replacement of commercial glass fiber separator in zinc ion batteries by wet forming of waste ZrO2 fibers. Materials Letters 2023, 331, 133546. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.matlet.2022.133546.

  • [3] Shuai Xu, Pengfei Sun, Jiangdong Sun, et al. Polypyrrole coated ammonium vanadate cathode endow high-rate capability to aqueous zinc-on batteries. Materials Letters 2023, 347, 134586. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.matlet.2023.134586.

  • [4] Shuai Xu, Pengfei Sun, Jiangdong Sun, et al. Flexible and fiber-shaped batteries−A review. Acta Materiae Compositae Sinica 2023, 40 (2), 665-677. https://doi.org/10.13801/j.cnki.fhclxb.20220527.002.

  • [5] Wenqi Nie, Shuai Xu, Jiangdong Sun, et al. Preparation and performance of zinc@polypyrrole fabric electrode. Acta Materiae Compositae Sinica 2022, 39 (12), 5792-5802. https://doi.org/10.13801/j.cnki.fhclxb.20211214.001.

item.title: PARTICIPATION PUBLICATIONS

  • [3] Wenqi Nie, Shuai Xu, Jiangdong Sun, Pengfei Sun, Zhenzhen Xu. A fiber battery and its scale-up preparation method. item.title: LANGUAGE and SKILLS
item.content:
• LANGUAGE: Mandarin (Native), English (IELTS:  prepared; CET4:  463)
  • Schematic drawing of scientific papers: 3Dmax, Blender, KeyShot, Photoshop, and so on
  • Machine learning based on 1D CNN method
